parameter.name: publicIDpattern
parameter.description: PublicID creation pattern for an origin created by RTDD.

parameter.name: activeProfiles
parameter.description: Defines a list of active profiles.

parameter.name: profileTimeAlive
parameter.description: Defines how long the profile data should be kept in memery (in minutes). This is useful to release memory (catalog waveform data) after a period of inactivity, but it means the waveforms will have to be reloaded whenever a new event occurs (i.e. it will take more time to relocate an origin). Set a negative value to keep the profile data always in memory.

parameter.name: cacheWaveforms
parameter.description: Save catalog waveforms to local disk to avoid reading them from the configured recordStream when a profile is loaded (see profileTimeAlive). Also the projected waveforms are saved (e.g. ZRT projection for S phase), which saves additional time when a profile is loaded. The waveforms are saved in the working directory and it is safe to delete them, if that's required for any reason. The waveforms will be then saved again on disk the next time the profile is loaded (they will be read again from the configured recordStream).

parameter.name: manualOrigin
parameter.description: Enables relocation of any manual origin. If false, only event preferred origins are relocated.

parameter.name: workingDirectory
parameter.description: Defines the directory used for storing temporary processing files.

parameter.name: keepWorkingFiles
parameter.description: Do not delete temporary processing files from the working directory after the processing is completed.

parameter.name: hypoddPath
parameter.description: Path to hypodd executable.

parameter.name: ph2dtPath
parameter.description: Path to ph2dt executable. This configuration is used only for full catalog relocation (see command line option --relocate-catalog) and it is not needed in real time DD relocation.

parameter.name: wakeupInterval
parameter.description: Specifies the interval in seconds to check/start scheduled operations.

parameter.name: delayTimes
parameter.description: Specifies a list of delay times in seconds relative to event time to trigger the processing. When the first origin of an event arrives this list is used to construct the crontab for this event. Example: "60, 120, 300, 3600"

parameter.name: updateDelay
parameter.description: Specifies the delay in seconds to delay processing if a new authoritative origin arrives for an event.

parameter.name: eventMaxIdleTime
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum allowed idle time of a process before removed. The idle time is calculated if no further processing is scheduled and computes as: [now]-lastRun.

parameter.name: logging
parameter.description: Enables/disables updating of a cron log file. This file will be created at ~/.seiscomp3/log/[appname].sched and contains information about the scheduled events and the processing queue. The file is updated each n seconds, where n = rtdd.cron.wakeupInterval.

struct.description: Defines a regional profile. Origins that fall in this region will use this configuration. If an origin falls in multiple profile regions, then the profile defined first will be used.

parameter.name: regionType
parameter.description: Type of region: RECTANGLE or CIRCLE

parameter.name: region
parameter.description: Defines the region values. If regionType is RECTANGLE then 4 values (min_lat, min_lon, max_lat, max_lon) are expected. If regionType is CIRCLE then 3 values are expected (lat, lon, radius in km). If region is empty, then it will represent a region that matches any origin.

parameter.name: earthModelID
parameter.description: earthModelID that is stored in the created origin.

parameter.name: methodID
parameter.description: methodID that is stored in the created origin.

group.name: catalog
group.description: The files used to define a catalog. There are two ways to define a catalog: one is providing an event file containing the ids of existing events or origins; the second way consists in providing extended information (useful when the events are not in the database) and three files are required event, phase and stations. The files must be in csv format with the first line containing the column names. Each file requires a minimum set of columns, which can appear in any order. Additional columns can be present and will not be used but are allowed for informationl purpose.

parameter.name: eventFile
parameter.description: Path to event file to be used for this profile. Required columns: seiscompId (this must be a valide seiscomp3 origin id or event id) Extended format columns: id,isotime,latitude,longitude,depth,magnitude,horiz_err,depth_err,tt_residual If the extended format is used, then the phase and station files must be provided. Conversely, if the format used is the one with seiscompId, no other files have to be provided and the event information will be fetched from the database.

parameter.name: phaFile
parameter.description: Path to catalog picks file to be used for this profile Required columns: eventId,stationId,isotime,weight,type,networkcode,stationcode,locationCode,channelCode

parameter.name: stationFile
parameter.description: Path to the stations file to be used for this profile Required columns: id,latitude,longitude,elevation,networkcode,stationcode
